intro: Smithia bingilensis, commonly known as the Bingilensis Smithia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
